------=_Part_1729930_2136259518.1479784349963
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You my friend, lucked out. =C2=A0
I didn't find rental stores for video gam=
es until the fourth gen systems came out, but I only went there for Neo Geo=
 games: I learned my lesson early on if I can beat a $200 game in a day I'm=
 probably better off renting it first instead. =C2=A0
Luckily, Electronics =
Boutique used to let you return games back then. =C2=A0=C2=A0
But I digress=
: I never rented from Blockbuster (except when I briefly worked there) and =
I cannot remember the name of the place I rented from but they were the onl=
y place that rented Neo Geo games and I think they were in Huntington, New =
York.=C2=A0
It would have been great to have had a place to rent Astrocade =
games back in the day but I think I wound up buying a lot of the cart games=
 anyway, but The Incredible Wizard was most likely my last and only Astroca=
de branded game I purchased back then.=C2=A0
I never knew about 3rd party g=
ames like Muncher and Blast Droids back in the day, but I was probably too =
much into my ColecoVision at the time anyway, leaving by Bally Computer Sys=
tem to collect dust. =C2=A0
So sad.=C2=A0
-Michael

      From: "Brian Cies=
icki tripletopper@... [ballyalley]" <ballyalley@yahoogroups.com>
=
 To: ballyalley@yahoogroups.com 
 Sent: Monday, November 21, 2016 12:22 PM
=
 Subject: Re: [ballyalley] High Score Club, Round 13 - Blast Droids and Hau=
nted House [1 Attachment]
   
=C2=A0   [Attachment(s) from Brian Ciesicki i=
ncluded below] 

Stores that rented Atari consoles and games were quite rar=
e in the early 80s (or, anytime, really).=C2=A0 So, let me get this right..=
. there was a store near you that rented Astrocade systems and games?=C2=A0=
 This is the first I've ever heard of this.=C2=A0 Where was it located?
It =
was a local chain in the east-side suburbs of Cleveland known as Captain Vi=
deo. =C2=A0 They sold and rented VCRs, TV=E2=80=99s, and video game console=
s. =C2=A0 We went there because they had Betamax rentals. =C2=A0That was th=
e first time I was exposed to the Astrocade. =C2=A0 I tried Incredible Wiza=
rd, this was back when I was a kid. =C2=A0It looked more colorful than 2600=
=E2=80=99s Wizard of Wor. =C2=A0First I thought it was a paddle and couldn=
=E2=80=99t move it. =C2=A0Then I thought the trigger was a Thumb trigger an=
d the directions were reversed, =C2=A0 As it turns it, it=E2=80=99s both a =
Joystick and Paddle simultaneously. =C2=A0It might have been before I got t=
he Colecovision.
There was also a place in the National Park Area near Akro=
n called Video Replay that sold and rented everything for every console. =
=C2=A0 They had Coleco, Vectrex, Intellivision, Odyssey 2, 2600, 5200. =C2=
=A0I=E2=80=99m not sure if they had Astrocade or not, but they probably did=
. =C2=A0 They may have even had Arcadia 2001, but I didn=E2=80=99t notice i=
t when I was a kid. I didn=E2=80=99t know the Arcadia even existed at that =
point. =C2=A0They also had VHS and Beta rentals too. =C2=A0They were a much=
 smaller store than Captain Video, but Captain video sold the TVs, VCRs and=
 Video Games in addition to renting.
Yes, Captain Video was really pushing =
those Astrocades. =C2=A0 They only had 2600 and Astrocade.
Also one of my c=
artridges looks like a sample cartridge wth a message saying sample belongs=
 to Jack Nieman. =C2=A0Is Jack Nieman involved in any way with Bally/Astroc=
ade? =C2=A0Here=E2=80=99s a picture of my actual cartridge:

0">Stores that rented Atari consoles and games were quite rare in the early=
 80s (or, anytime, really).  So, let me get this right... there was a =
store near you that rented Astrocade systems and games?  This is the f=
irst I've ever heard of this.  Where was it located?</div></div></div>=
</div></div></div></blockquote></div>It was a local chain in the east-side =
suburbs of Cleveland known as Captain Video.   They sold and rented VC=
Rs, TV=E2=80=99s, and video game consoles.   We went there because the=
y had Betamax rentals.  That was the first time I was exposed to the A=
strocade.   I tried Incredible Wizard, this was back when I was a kid.=
  It looked more colorful than 2600=E2=80=99s Wizard of Wor.  Fir=
st I thought it was a paddle and couldn=E2=80=99t move it.  Then I tho=
ught the trigger was a Thumb trigger and the directions were reversed, &nbs=
p; As it turns it, it=E2=80=99s both a Joystick and Paddle simultaneously. =
 It might have been before I got the Colecovision.<div class=3D"yiv308=
7136338class" id=3D"yui_3_16_0_ym19_1_1479783383964_25483"><br clear=3D"non=
e" class=3D"yiv3087136338class"></div><div class=3D"yiv3087136338class">The=
re was also a place in the National Park Area near Akron called Video Repla=
y that sold and rented everything for every console.   They had Coleco=
, Vectrex, Intellivision, Odyssey 2, 2600, 5200.  I=E2=80=99m not sure=
 if they had Astrocade or not, but they probably did.   They may have =
even had Arcadia 2001, but I didn=E2=80=99t notice it when I was a kid. I d=
idn=E2=80=99t know the Arcadia even existed at that point.  They also =
had VHS and Beta rentals too.  They were a much smaller store than Cap=
tain Video, but Captain video sold the TVs, VCRs and Video Games in additio=
n to renting.</div><div class=3D"yiv3087136338class" id=3D"yui_3_16_0_ym19_=
1_1479783383964_25468"><br clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv3087136338class"></di=
v><div class=3D"yiv3087136338class" id=3D"yui_3_16_0_ym19_1_1479783383964_2=
5469">Yes, Captain Video was really pushing those Astrocades.   They o=
nly had 2600 and Astrocade.</div><div class=3D"yiv3087136338class" id=3D"yu=
i_3_16_0_ym19_1_1479783383964_25471"><br clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv3087136=
338class"></div><div class=3D"yiv3087136338class" id=3D"yui_3_16_0_ym19_1_1=
479783383964_25473">Also one of my cartridges looks like a sample cartridge=
 wth a message saying sample belongs to Jack Nieman.  Is Jack Nieman i=
nvolved in any way with Bally/Astrocade?  Here=E2=80=99s a picture of =
my actual cartridge:</div><div class=3D"yiv3087136338class" id=3D"yui_3_16_=
0_ym19_1_1479783383964_25475"><img class=3D"yiv3087136338class" id=3D"yiv30=
